properties.Name: MineMetrics
properties.Description: Metrics related to the mine over the associated period.

Columns.Name: MineId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a mine.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartDate
Columns.Description: The period start date.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndDate
Columns.Description: The period end date.

Columns.Name: TotalExcavatedMaterialTons
Columns.Description: The total excavated material (ore + non-ore) tons during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineShippingCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of mine shipping costs during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineTruckShippingCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of mine truck shipping costs during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineRailShippingCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of mine rail shipping costs during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineShipShippingCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of mine ship/waterway shipping costs during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalEmployeesHired
Columns.Description: The total number of new employees hired during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalContractorsHired
Columns.Description: The total number of contractors hired during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalEmployeesRetired
Columns.Description: The total number of employees retired during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalWorkerInjuries
Columns.Description: The total number of worker injuries during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalWorkHoursLostToInjuries
Columns.Description: The total number of work hours lost due to injuries during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalWorkerInjuriesMedicalCostsIncurredAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of work-related injury medical costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalWorkerFatalities
Columns.Description: The total number of worker fatalities during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalWorkerSafetyComplianceCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of worker safety compliance costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalWorkerLegalCompensationPaidAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of worker legal compensation paid during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalEmployeeSubstanceAbuseIncidents
Columns.Description: The total number of employee substance abuse related incidents during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalEmployeesTerminated
Columns.Description: The total number of employees terminated during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineWorkerSafetyPenaltiesCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of penalties paid for violations of worker safety during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalEmployeeSalariesPaidAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of employee salaries paid during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalEmployeeBenefitsPaidAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of employee benefits paid during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalContractorSalariesPaidAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of contractor salaries paid during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineDependentCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of employee dependent costs during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineEmployeeProgramCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of employee program costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineDependentProgramCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of dependent program costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineDevelopmentCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of mine development costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineAdministrativeCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of mine administrative costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineLaborsCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of labor costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineEquipmentCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of equipment costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineMaintenanceCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of maintenance costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineInventoryCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of inventory costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineTestingCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of testing costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineConstructionCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of construction costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineElectricalUsageMw
Columns.Description: The total mine electrical usage in mW during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineElectricalUsageCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of electrical costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineWaterUsageGallons
Columns.Description: The total mine water usage in gallons.

Columns.Name: TotalMineWaterCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of water costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineEnvironmentalMonitoringCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of environmental monitoring costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineEnvironmentalComplianceCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of environmental compliance costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineEnvironmentalPenaltiesCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of environmental penalties costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalWorkerMiningRelatedInjuries
Columns.Description: The total number of mining-related injuries incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalWorkerNonMiningRelatedInjuries
Columns.Description: The total number of non-mining-related injuries incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineEnergyCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total mine energy costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: EmployeesToFatalitiesRatio
Columns.Description:
The ratio of employees to fatalities.

(Number of Employees/Number of Fatalities)x100

Columns.Name: EmployeesToInjuriesRatio
Columns.Description:
The ratio of employees to injuries.

(Number of Employees/Number of Injuries)x100

Columns.Name: EmployeesToMineProductionRatio
Columns.Description:
The employees to mine production ratio.

(Number of Employees/Mine Production Tons)x100

Columns.Name: EmployeesToMineExpensesRatio
Columns.Description:
The employees to mine expenses ratio.

(Number of Employees/Total Mine Expenses)x100

Columns.Name: EmployeesToContractorsRatio
Columns.Description:
The employees to contractors ratio.

(Number of Employees/Number of Contractors)x100

Columns.Name: MiningRelatedMaleToFemaleEmployeesRatio
Columns.Description:
The ratio of mining male to female employees during the period.

(Number of Mining Male Employees/Number of Mining Female Employees)x100

Columns.Name: NonMiningRelatedMaleToFemaleEmployeesRatio
Columns.Description:
The ratio of non-mining male to female employees during the period.

(Number of Non-mining Male Employees/Number of Non-mining Female Employees)x100

Columns.Name: MaleToFemaleEmployeesRatio
Columns.Description:
The ratio of total male to female employees during the period.

(Number of Male Employees/Number of Female Employees)x100

Columns.Name: TotalNumberOfEmployeeDependents
Columns.Description: The total number of employee dependents during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineEmployeeDependentCostsAmount
Columns.Description: The total employee dependent costs amount during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineContributionToCorporateProfitsAmount
Columns.Description: The total contribution to corporate profits from mining activities during the period.

Columns.Name: TotalMineContributionToCorporateExpensesAmount
Columns.Description: The total contribution to corporate expenses from mining activities during the period.

Columns.Name: MineStrippingRatio
Columns.Description:
The ratio of overburden and waste to product in an open pit operation.

(Total Overburden Tons/Total Product Mined)x100

Columns.Name: MineYieldRecoverableGradeRatio
Columns.Description: The actual grade of ore realized after the mining and treatment process.

Columns.Name: MineProductionUnits
Columns.Description: production.--The coal that has been extracted from a mine for a specified period. Production may be reported for a mine or larger area such as a coal field, region, province, basin, township, quadrangle, state, nation, and (or) the world. Production in the United States is usually reported in short tons; most other nations report production in metric tons.

Columns.Name: MineEstimatedReservesUnits
Columns.Description: The estimated reserve units associated with the mine for the period.

Columns.Name: MineConfirmedReservesUnits
Columns.Description: The reserve units confirmed for the mine for the period.

Columns.Name: MineProductiveCapacityUnits
Columns.Description:
Productive Capacity: 
The maximum amount of coal that a mining operation
can produce or process during a period with the existing mining equipment
and/or preparation plant in place, assuming that the labor and materials
sufficient to utilize the plant and equipment are available, and that the
market exists for the maximum production.

Columns.Name: MineRecoveryPercentage
Columns.Description:
The percentage of coal that recovered from
the coal deposits at existing mines.

Columns.Name: MineEstimatedUndiscoveredResourcesUnits
Columns.Description:
Undiscovered Resources: 
Unspecified bodies of coal surmised to exist on
the basis of broad geologic knowledge and theory. Undiscovered
resources include beds of bituminous coal and anthracite 14 inches or
more thick and beds of subbituminous coal and lignite 30 inches or more
thick that are presumed to occur in unmapped and unexplored areas to
depths of 6,000 feet. The speculative and hypothetical resource categories
comprise undiscovered resources.

Columns.Name: MineProbableReservesUnits
Columns.Description: Probable (Indicated) reserves. Reserves for which quantity and grade and/or quality are computed from information similar to that used for proven reserves, but the sites for inspection, sampling and measurement are farther apart; therefore, the degree of assurance, although lower than that for proven reserves, is high enough to assume continuity between points of observation.

Columns.Name: MineProvenReservesUnits
Columns.Description:
Proven (Measured) reserves. Reserves for which (a) quantity is computed from dimensions revealed in outcrops, trenches, workings or drill holes; grade and/or quality are computed from the results of detailed sampling and (b) the sites for inspection, sampling and measurement are spaced so closely and the geologic character is so well defined that size, shape, depth and mineral content of reserves are well established.

Proven (Measured) reserves. Reserves for which (a) quantity is computed from dimensions revealed in outcrops, trenches, workings or drill holes; grade and/or quality are computed from the results of detailed sampling and (b) the sites for inspection, sampling and measurement are spaced so closely and the geologic character is so well defined that size, shape, depth and mineral content of reserves are well established.

Columns.Name: MineAssignedReservesUnits
Columns.Description: Coal which has been committed by the coal company to operating mine shafts, mining equipment, and plant facilities, and all coal which has been leased by the company to others.

Columns.Name: MineRecoverableReservesUnits
Columns.Description: Recoverable reserves. The amount of proven and probable reserves that can actually be recovered from the reserve base taking into account all mining and preparation losses involved in producing a saleable product using existing methods and under current law.

Columns.Name: MineReservesUnits
Columns.Description: Reserves. That part of a mineral deposit which could be economically and legally extracted or produced at the time of the reserve determination.

Columns.Name: MineUnassignedResourcesUnits
Columns.Description: Unassigned reserves. Coal which has not been committed, and which would require new mineshafts, mining equipment, or plant facilities before operations could begin in the property.

Columns.Name: MineCumulativeDepletionUnits
Columns.Description: cumulative depletion.--The sum in tons of coal extracted and lost-in-mining to a stated date for a specified area or a specified coal bed.

Columns.Name: MineDepletedResourcesUnits
Columns.Description: depleted resources.--Resources that have been mined; includes coal recovered, coal lost-in-mining, and coal reclassified as subeconomic because of mining.

Columns.Name: MineCumulativeProductionUnits
Columns.Description: cumulative production.--The sum in tons of coal extracted to a stated date for a specified area or a specified coal bed.

Columns.Name: MineLostInMiningUnits
Columns.Description: lost-in-mining.--Coal remaining in the ground after all extraction is completed. Lost-in-mining includes coal that is (1) left to support mine roofs, (2) too thin to mine, (3) unmined around oil, gas, water, and disposal wells, (4) unmined around shafts and electrical and water conduits, (5) unmined as barrier pillars adjacent to mine or property boundaries, (6) unmined adjacent to haulageways, tunnels, airways, and waterways, (7) unmined because of many other unspecified reasons, (8) the unrecovered or unrecoverable part of any coal bed in a mining property that has been or may be extracted, (9) all unrecoverable in beds that closely overlie a mined bed, (10) all unrecoverable in beds that closely underlie a mined bed, (11) unmined between mining properties.

Columns.Name: MineMarginalReservesUnits
Columns.Description: marginal reserves.--Borders on being economic. See economic; general guideline no. 8; and subdivisions of reserves.

Columns.Name: MineInferredReserveBaseUnits
Columns.Description: reserve base, inferred.--The in-place part of an identified resource from which inferred reserves and inferred marginal reserves are estimated. Quantitative estimates are based largely on knowledge of the geologic character of a coal deposit for which there are no samples or measurements. The estimates are based on an assumed continuity beyond the reserve base for which there is geologic evidence.

Columns.Name: MineOverburdenRatio
Columns.Description: Overburden ratio. The amount of overburden commonly stated in cubic yards that must be removed to excavate one ton of coal.

Columns.Name: MineIndicatedResourcesUnits
Columns.Description: Indicated Resources.--Identified bodies of virgin coal having a moderate degree of geologic assurance.

Columns.Name: MineRecoverableUnits
Columns.Description: Recoverable coal?Recoverable coal refers to the amount of coal that can be removed

Columns.Name: MineEstimatedRemainingResourcesUnits
Columns.Description: Remaining Resources.--The resources in the ground in a mine, area, field, basin, region, province, county, state, and (or) nation after some mining. The term does not include coal lost-in-mining unless such coal can be considered potentially recoverable. Remaining resources may be divided into categories such as remaining economic, marginally economic, subeconomic, measured, indicated, inferred, identified, and undiscovered (hypothetical and speculative) resources or other types of resources.

Columns.Name: MineAccessibleReserveBaseUnits
Columns.Description:
Accessible Reserve Base: 
The portion of the demonstrated reserve base
estimated by EIA to be accessible, determined by application of one or
more accessibility factors within an area. An accessible reserve base may
be referred to as accessible resources because it is a subset of accessible
resources and is usually part of a single resource study.
Accessible Resources: The portion of identified resources

Columns.Name: MineAverageDailyProductionUnits
Columns.Description:
Average Daily Production: 
The ratio of the total production at a mining
operation to the total number of production days worked at the operation.

Columns.Name: MineAverageLengthOfShiftHours
Columns.Description:
Average Length of a Shift: 
The arithmetic mean number of hours worked
during a production shift. Overtime is included if usually worked during the
year.

Columns.Name: MineAverageNumberEmployeesPerShift
Columns.Description:
Average Number of Employees per Shift: 
The arithmetic mean number of
employees working during a shift. Includes all employees except office
workers. (See direct labor hours.)

Columns.Name: MineAverageMinePriceDollars
Columns.Description:
The ratio of the total value of the coal produced at the
mine to the total production tonnage. (See F.O.B. mine price.)

Columns.Name: MineAverageNumberOfShiftsPerDay
Columns.Description:
Average Number of Shifts per Day: 
The arithmetic mean number of shifts
each day at a mining operation. Includes maintenance as well as
production shifts.

Columns.Name: MineAverageNumberOfMinersWorkingDaily
Columns.Description:
Average Number of Miners Working Daily: 
The arithmetic mean number of
miners working each day at a mining operation. Includes maintenance as
well as production work performed.

Columns.Name: MineAverageOpenMarketSalesPriceDollars
Columns.Description:
Average Open Market Sales Price: 
The ratio of the total value of the open
market sales of coal produced at the mine to the total open market sales
tonnage.

Columns.Name: MineAverageProductionPerMinerPerDayUnits
Columns.Description:
Average Production per Miner per Day: 
The product of the average
production per miner per hour at a mining operation and the average length
of a shift at the operation.

Columns.Name: MineAverageProductionUnitsPerMinerPerHour
Columns.Description:
Average Production per Miner per Hour: 
The ratio of total production at a
mining operation to the total direct labor hours worked at the operation.

Columns.Name: MineDepletionFactorPercentage
Columns.Description:
Depletion Factor: 
The multiplier applied to the tonnage produced to
compute depletion. This multiplier takes into account both the tonnage
recovered and the tonnage lost due to mining. The depletion factor is the
reciprocal of the recovery factor in relation to a given quantity of
production.

Columns.Name: MineDirectLaborHours
Columns.Description:
Direct Labor Hours: 
Direct labor hours worked by all mining employees at a
mining operation during the year. Includes hours worked by those
employees engaged in production, preparation, development, maintenance,
repair, shop or yard work, management, technical or engineering work, and
office workers. Excludes vacation and leave hours.

Columns.Name: MineInferredResourcesUnits
Columns.Description:
Inferred Resources: 
Coal in unexplored extensions of demonstrated
resources for which estimates of the quality and size are based on geologic
evidence and projection. Quantitative estimates are based largely on broad
knowledge of the geologic character of the bed or region and where few
measurements of bed thickness are available. The estimates are based
primarily on an assumed continuation from demonstrated coal for which
there is geologic evidence. The points of observation are 1.5 to 6 miles
apart. Inferred coal is projected to extend as a 2.25-mile-wide belt that lies
more than 0.75 miles from the outcrop or points of observation or
measurement.

(Total Overburden Tons/Total Product Mined)x100","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineStrippingRatio"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineYieldRecoverableGradeRatio"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"The actual grade of ore realized after the mining and treatment process.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineYieldRecoverableGradeRatio"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineProductionUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"production.--The coal that has been extracted from a mine for a specified period. Production may be reported for a mine or larger area such as a coal field, region, province, basin, township, quadrangle, state, nation, and (or) the world. Production in the United States is usually reported in short tons; most other nations report production in metric tons.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineProductionUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineEstimatedReservesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"The estimated reserve units associated with the mine for the period.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineEstimatedReservesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineConfirmedReservesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"The reserve units confirmed for the mine for the period.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineConfirmedReservesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineProductiveCapacityUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Productive Capacity: 
The maximum amount of coal that a mining operation
can produce or process during a period with the existing mining equipment
and/or preparation plant in place, assuming that the labor and materials
sufficient to utilize the plant and equipment are available, and that the
market exists for the maximum production.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineProductiveCapacityUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineRecoveryPercentage"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"The percentage of coal that recovered from
the coal deposits at existing mines.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineRecoveryPercentage"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineEstimatedUndiscoveredResourcesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Undiscovered Resources: 
Unspecified bodies of coal surmised to exist on
the basis of broad geologic knowledge and theory. Undiscovered
resources include beds of bituminous coal and anthracite 14 inches or
more thick and beds of subbituminous coal and lignite 30 inches or more
thick that are presumed to occur in unmapped and unexplored areas to
depths of 6,000 feet. The speculative and hypothetical resource categories
comprise undiscovered resources.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineEstimatedUndiscoveredResourcesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineProbableReservesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Probable (Indicated) reserves. Reserves for which quantity and grade and/or quality are computed from information similar to that used for proven reserves, but the sites for inspection, sampling and measurement are farther apart; therefore, the degree of assurance, although lower than that for proven reserves, is high enough to assume continuity between points of observation.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineProbableReservesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineProvenReservesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Proven (Measured) reserves. Reserves for which (a) quantity is computed from dimensions revealed in outcrops, trenches, workings or drill holes; grade and/or quality are computed from the results of detailed sampling and (b) the sites for inspection, sampling and measurement are spaced so closely and the geologic character is so well defined that size, shape, depth and mineral content of reserves are well established.

Proven (Measured) reserves. Reserves for which (a) quantity is computed from dimensions revealed in outcrops, trenches, workings or drill holes; grade and/or quality are computed from the results of detailed sampling and (b) the sites for inspection, sampling and measurement are spaced so closely and the geologic character is so well defined that size, shape, depth and mineral content of reserves are well established.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineProvenReservesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineAssignedReservesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Coal which has been committed by the coal company to operating mine shafts, mining equipment, and plant facilities, and all coal which has been leased by the company to others.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineAssignedReservesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineRecoverableReservesUnits"},"dataType":"integer","description":"Recoverable reserves. The amount of proven and probable reserves that can actually be recovered from the reserve base taking into account all mining and preparation losses involved in producing a saleable product using existing methods and under current law.","isNullable":true,"name":"MineRecoverableReservesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineReservesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Reserves. That part of a mineral deposit which could be economically and legally extracted or produced at the time of the reserve determination.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineReservesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineUnassignedResourcesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Unassigned reserves. Coal which has not been committed, and which would require new mineshafts, mining equipment, or plant facilities before operations could begin in the property.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineUnassignedResourcesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineCumulativeDepletionUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"cumulative depletion.--The sum in tons of coal extracted and lost-in-mining to a stated date for a specified area or a specified coal bed.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineCumulativeDepletionUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineDepletedResourcesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"depleted resources.--Resources that have been mined; includes coal recovered, coal lost-in-mining, and coal reclassified as subeconomic because of mining.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineDepletedResourcesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineCumulativeProductionUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"cumulative production.--The sum in tons of coal extracted to a stated date for a specified area or a specified coal bed.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineCumulativeProductionUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineLostInMiningUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"lost-in-mining.--Coal remaining in the ground after all extraction is completed. Lost-in-mining includes coal that is (1) left to support mine roofs, (2) too thin to mine, (3) unmined around oil, gas, water, and disposal wells, (4) unmined around shafts and electrical and water conduits, (5) unmined as barrier pillars adjacent to mine or property boundaries, (6) unmined adjacent to haulageways, tunnels, airways, and waterways, (7) unmined because of many other unspecified reasons, (8) the unrecovered or unrecoverable part of any coal bed in a mining property that has been or may be extracted, (9) all unrecoverable in beds that closely overlie a mined bed, (10) all unrecoverable in beds that closely underlie a mined bed, (11) unmined between mining properties.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineLostInMiningUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineMarginalReservesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"marginal reserves.--Borders on being economic. See economic; general guideline no. 8; and subdivisions of reserves.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineMarginalReservesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineInferredReserveBaseUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"reserve base, inferred.--The in-place part of an identified resource from which inferred reserves and inferred marginal reserves are estimated. Quantitative estimates are based largely on knowledge of the geologic character of a coal deposit for which there are no samples or measurements. The estimates are based on an assumed continuity beyond the reserve base for which there is geologic evidence.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineInferredReserveBaseUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineOverburdenRatio"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Overburden ratio. The amount of overburden commonly stated in cubic yards that must be removed to excavate one ton of coal.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineOverburdenRatio"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineIndicatedResourcesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Indicated Resources.--Identified bodies of virgin coal having a moderate degree of geologic assurance.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineIndicatedResourcesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineRecoverableUnits"},"dataType":"integer","description":"Recoverable coal?Recoverable coal refers to the amount of coal that can be removed","isNullable":true,"name":"MineRecoverableUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineEstimatedRemainingResourcesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Remaining Resources.--The resources in the ground in a mine, area, field, basin, region, province, county, state, and (or) nation after some mining. The term does not include coal lost-in-mining unless such coal can be considered potentially recoverable. Remaining resources may be divided into categories such as remaining economic, marginally economic, subeconomic, measured, indicated, inferred, identified, and undiscovered (hypothetical and speculative) resources or other types of resources.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineEstimatedRemainingResourcesUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineAccessibleReserveBaseUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Accessible Reserve Base: 
The portion of the demonstrated reserve base
estimated by EIA to be accessible, determined by application of one or
more accessibility factors within an area. An accessible reserve base may
be referred to as accessible resources because it is a subset of accessible
resources and is usually part of a single resource study.
Accessible Resources: The portion of identified resources","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineAccessibleReserveBaseUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineAverageDailyProductionUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Average Daily Production: 
The ratio of the total production at a mining
operation to the total number of production days worked at the operation.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineAverageDailyProductionUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineAverageLengthOfShiftHours"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Average Length of a Shift: 
The arithmetic mean number of hours worked
during a production shift. Overtime is included if usually worked during the
year.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineAverageLengthOfShiftHours"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineAverageNumberEmployeesPerShift"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Average Number of Employees per Shift: 
The arithmetic mean number of
employees working during a shift. Includes all employees except office
workers. (See direct labor hours.)","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineAverageNumberEmployeesPerShift"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineAverageMinePriceDollars"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"The ratio of the total value of the coal produced at the
mine to the total production tonnage. (See F.O.B. mine price.)","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineAverageMinePriceDollars"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineAverageNumberOfShiftsPerDay"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Average Number of Shifts per Day: 
The arithmetic mean number of shifts
each day at a mining operation. Includes maintenance as well as
production shifts.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineAverageNumberOfShiftsPerDay"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineAverageNumberOfMinersWorkingDaily"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Average Number of Miners Working Daily: 
The arithmetic mean number of
miners working each day at a mining operation. Includes maintenance as
well as production work performed.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineAverageNumberOfMinersWorkingDaily"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineAverageOpenMarketSalesPriceDollars"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Average Open Market Sales Price: 
The ratio of the total value of the open
market sales of coal produced at the mine to the total open market sales
tonnage.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineAverageOpenMarketSalesPriceDollars"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineAverageProductionPerMinerPerDayUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Average Production per Miner per Day: 
The product of the average
production per miner per hour at a mining operation and the average length
of a shift at the operation.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineAverageProductionPerMinerPerDayUnits"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineAverageProductionUnitsPerMinerPerHour"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Average Production per Miner per Hour: 
The ratio of total production at a
mining operation to the total direct labor hours worked at the operation.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineAverageProductionUnitsPerMinerPerHour"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineDepletionFactorPercentage"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Depletion Factor: 
The multiplier applied to the tonnage produced to
compute depletion. This multiplier takes into account both the tonnage
recovered and the tonnage lost due to mining. The depletion factor is the
reciprocal of the recovery factor in relation to a given quantity of
production.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineDepletionFactorPercentage"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineDirectLaborHours"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Direct Labor Hours: 
Direct labor hours worked by all mining employees at a
mining operation during the year. Includes hours worked by those
employees engaged in production, preparation, development, maintenance,
repair, shop or yard work, management, technical or engineering work, and
office workers. Excludes vacation and leave hours.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineDirectLaborHours"},{"type":"Existing","attributeReference":{"entity":"MineMetrics.cdm.json/MineMetrics","name":"MineInferredResourcesUnits"},"dataType":"decimal","dataTypeLength":18,"description":"Inferred Resources: 
Coal in unexplored extensions of demonstrated
resources for which estimates of the quality and size are based on geologic
evidence and projection. Quantitative estimates are based largely on broad
knowledge of the geologic character of the bed or region and where few
measurements of bed thickness are available. The estimates are based
primarily on an assumed continuation from demonstrated coal for which
there is geologic evidence. The points of observation are 1.5 to 6 miles
apart. Inferred coal is projected to extend as a 2.25-mile-wide belt that lies
more than 0.75 miles from the outcrop or points of observation or
measurement.","isNullable":true,"scale":8,"name":"MineInferredResourcesUnits"}]}}}
Properties.Description: Metrics related to the mine over the associated period.
